author: pburba
msg: Follow-up to r25514, note in merge test that we don't yet handle missing dirs.
(mergeinfo_and_skipped_paths): Be specific about what this test *doesn't*

author: pburba
msg: Follow-up to r25547, Note that the revs the file mods take place are
based on the number of branches created.

author: hwright
msg: Ignore branching revisions when running 'svn log -g'.
To do this, we basically duplicate the implicit mergeinfo calculation from
libsvn_client/copy.c:get_implied_mergeinfo(), and check it against the current
mergeinfo to "guess" that the path and revision in question is a branching
revision, and ignore it for generating the mergeinfo diffs.
Because of layering issues, and circular dependencies, this is implemented as a
filter callback function passed to svn_fs_mergeinfo_for_tree().
Note:  This fixes one problem at the expense of creating a less serious one,
hence the marking of log_tests 19 as XFail.  The cause is known and a solution
under investigation.  (This was fixed in r25594.)
Add filter_func arguments and filter each path mergeinfo is found on.
mergeinfo when search for child log messages.

author: dlr
msg: Refactor code for clarity and efficiency.
(svn_wc_revert2): For regular prop and text edits or deletions and
replacements, use a "switch" flow-control statement, nesting extra
handling for replacements inside of the handling for svn_node_dirs.
